original_solution_mapping.L1: First find the total number of degrees the candy needs to heat up: 240 degrees - 60 degrees = <<240-60=180>>180 degrees
original_solution_mapping.L2: Then divide that amount by the rate the candy heats up: 180 degrees / 5 degrees/minute = <<180/5=36>>36 minutes
original_solution_mapping.L3: Then find the number of degrees the candy needs to cool down: 240 degrees - 170 degrees = <<240-170=70>>70 degrees
original_solution_mapping.L4: Then divide that by the rate the candy cool down: 70 degrees / 7 degrees/minute = <<70/7=10>>10 minutes
original_solution_mapping.L5: Then add the time for the candy to heat to the time for it to cool to find the total time: 10 minutes + 36 minutes = <<10+36=46>>46 minutes

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6573.
    Returns: the total time in minutes for the candy to be done.
    """
    # L1
    target_heat_temp = 240 # to 240 degrees
    initial_temp = 60 # from 60 degrees
    degrees_to_heat = target_heat_temp - initial_temp

    # L2
    heat_rate = 5 # heats at 5 degrees/minute
    time_to_heat = degrees_to_heat / heat_rate

    # L3
    target_cool_temp = 170 # cool it down to 170 degrees
    degrees_to_cool = target_heat_temp - target_cool_temp

    # L4
    cool_rate = 7 # cools at 7 degrees/minute
    time_to_cool = degrees_to_cool / cool_rate

    # L5
    total_time = time_to_cool + time_to_heat

    # FA
    answer = total_time
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: First find the total number of degrees the candy needs to heat up: {target_heat_temp} degrees - {initial_temp} degrees = <<{target_heat_temp}-{initial_temp}={degrees_to_heat}>>{degrees_to_heat} degrees
Then divide that amount by the rate the candy heats up: {degrees_to_heat} degrees / {heat_rate} degrees/minute = <<{degrees_to_heat}/{heat_rate}={time_to_heat}>>{time_to_heat} minutes

Then find the number of degrees the candy needs to cool down: {target_heat_temp} degrees - {target_cool_temp} degrees = <<{target_heat_temp}-{target_cool_temp}={degrees_to_cool}>>{degrees_to_cool} degrees
Then divide that by the rate the candy cool down: {degrees_to_cool} degrees / {cool_rate} degrees/minute = <<{degrees_to_cool}/{cool_rate}={time_to_cool}>>{time_to_cool} minutes

Then add the time for the candy to heat to the time for it to cool to find the total time: {time_to_cool} minutes + {time_to_heat} minutes = <<{time_to_cool}+{time_to_heat}={total_time}>>{total_time} minutes
